title: Relates to filing and investigation of reports alleging educational neglect
summary: Relates to filing and investigation of reports alleging educational neglect; requires a hearing prior to filing a report with the local social services department and requires that the report be expunged where the report is determined to be unfounded.

       AN ACT to amend the social services  law,  in  relation  to  reports  of

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 8 of section 34-a of the social  services  law,

   17  submit written policies and procedures regarding the reporting of educa-

   23  such local policies and procedures, based upon the model  practices  and

    3    S  2.  Paragraph  (c)  of  subdivision  5 of section 422 of the social
    4  services law, as added by chapter 555 of the laws of 2000, is amended to
    5  read as follows:
    6    (c) Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the office of children
    7  and family services may, in its discretion, grant a request  to  expunge
    8  an unfounded report where: (i) the source of the report was convicted of
    9  a  violation  of subdivision three of section 240.55 of the penal law in
   10  regard to such report; or (ii) the subject of the report presents  clear
   11  and  convincing  evidence  that  affirmatively refutes the allegation of
   12  abuse or maltreatment; provided however, that the  absence  of  credible
   13  evidence supporting the allegation of abuse or maltreatment shall not be
   14  the sole basis to expunge the report, EXCEPT THAT WHERE THE MALTREATMENT
   15  ALLEGED  WAS  BASED  UPON A CLAIM OF EDUCATIONAL NEGLECT AND SUCH REPORT
   16  WAS DETERMINED TO BE UNFOUNDED THE OFFICE SHALL EXPUNGE THE REPORT BASED
   17  SOLELY UPON SUCH FINDING. Nothing in this paragraph  shall  require  the
   18  office of children and family services to hold an administrative hearing
   19  in  deciding  whether  to  expunge  a report. Such office shall make its
   20  determination upon reviewing  the  written  evidence  submitted  by  the
   21  subject  of  the report and any records or information obtained from the
   22  state or local agency which investigated the  allegations  of  abuse  or
   23  maltreatment.
   24    S 3. This act shall take effect immediately.
